Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Due to a busier than usual day, all of our engineers are currently working on other faults. We have made the local teams aware of your power cut and they are working hard to find resources to attend and get your power back on. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 14:00 28/01/2025.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG5853'
Faults.name: SN13 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 24 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting the local area, and it's likely several streets in the area are affected by the same power cut.

We have engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at 12:00 27/01/2025. Once they arrive, they will get straight to work on investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continue to update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 06:00 28/01/2025.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our overhead network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG6088'
Faults.name: DT2 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 130 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting the local area, and it's likely several streets in the area are affected by the same power cut.

We have engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at 17:00 27/01/2025. Once they arrive, they will get straight to work on investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continue to update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 23:59 27/01/2025.

We have had reports of a overhead power line coming down. When this happens, the power will automatically turn off to keep everyone safe. Our engineers know exactly where the problem is and are working hard to make the situation safe, repair the wire and get your power back on. These type of faults often require extensive work and specialist teams which is why the restoration time seems so far away. If we can restore power sooner, we promise we will do so.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG6552'

Faults.name: DT2 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

We have engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at 18:00 27/01/2025. Once they arrive, they will get straight to work on investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continue to update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 01:30 28/01/2025.

You may have noticed your power going on and off. This is nothing to worry about but is being caused by a fault on our network. The typical cause for this issue is that something is touching our overhead network - it is usually a tree branch. Our teams are locating the source of the problem as we speak and once we resolve the issue, your power will return to normal. In the meantime, we'd suggest turning off any sensitive appliances like computers and TVs.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG6850'

Faults.name: BA22 Area

Faults.message:
We're still working hard to get power restored to customers impacted by this fault.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and throughout the last 24 hours have been able to get power back on to a large number of areas. Our team of hundreds of engineers are still out throughout today in the last sprint effort to get every home and business back on power.

We're aiming to have power restored to almost every property by the end of the day on Monday. The damage to our network is severe and, in some cases, our engineers are needing to rebuild whole parts of the network which is why it's taken so long to get your power back on. We know some customers have been without power for some time now but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted sooner. We won't be standing down our teams until every single customer has their power back on.

As offered over the weekend, our support services including food reimbursement, welfare units, warm hubs and accommodation remain on offer for you. All the information about this can be found at www.ssen.co.uk/stormsupport/.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you're struggling at all or have any medical concerns without electricity, please call us on 105 and a member of the team will be happy to help.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

Faults.name: PA21 & PA23 Areas

Faults.message:
We're aware of an issue affecting the power for homes and businesses in this area.

Due to Storm Éowyn causing significant damage over the weekend, all our teams are very busy trying to get power back on for customers who have been off supply since Friday, Saturday or yesterday and this may mean it takes us a little longer to get a team of engineers to your area. The restoration time above is our current estimate based on the information we know, but if anything changes, we'll update this here and if you register for updates, we'll text you too.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please call us on 105 or send us a message on Facebook so one of the team can help.

Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

We know some customers have been without power for some time now but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted sooner. We won't be standing down our teams until every single customer has their power back on.

As offered over the weekend, our support services including food reimbursement, welfare units, warm hubs and accommodation remain on offer for you. All the information about this can be found at www.ssen.co.uk/stormsupport/.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you're struggling at all or have any medical concerns without electricity, please call us on 105 and a member of the team will be happy to help.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.
Faults.name: G63 Area

Faults.message:
We're still working hard to get power restored to customers impacted by this fault.

Our engineers have been working around the clock since the storm hit our network earlier on in the weekend, and throughout the last 24 hours have been able to get power back on to a large number of areas. Our team of hundreds of engineers are still out throughout today in the last sprint effort to get every home and business back on power.

We're aiming to have power restored to almost every property by the end of the day on Monday. The damage to our network is severe and, in some cases, our engineers are needing to rebuild whole parts of the network which is why it's taken so long to get your power back on. We know some customers have been without power for some time now but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted sooner. We won't be standing down our teams until every single customer has their power back on.

Faults.name: PA23 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of an issue affecting the power for homes and businesses in this area.

Due to Storm Éowyn causing significant damage over the weekend, all our teams are very busy trying to get power back on for customers who have been off supply since Friday, Saturday or yesterday and this may mean it takes us a little longer to get a team of engineers to your area. The restoration time above is our current estimate based on the information we know, but if anything changes, we'll update this here and if you register for updates, we'll text you too.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here on PowerTrack, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please call us on 105 or send us a message on Facebook so one of the team can help.

Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

Faults.name: PA28 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

We are in the process of arranging for engineers to get to your local area to investigate the issue and attempt to restore power. Once we have an engineer on the way, we will update this message. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by .

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG7276'
Faults.name: DD9 Area
